items.title: What is Vlang? An introduction - LogRocket Blog
items.htmlTitle: What is Vlang? An introduction - LogRocket Blog
items.snippet: Feb 25, 2021 ... To be more specific, Vlang is a statically typed programming language created by Alexander Medvednikov that became open source in July 2019.
items.htmlSnippet: Feb 25, 2021 ... To be more specific, Vlang is a statically typed programming language created by Alexander Medvednikov that became open source in July 2019.

metatags.author: Victor Jonah
metatags.og:title: What is Vlang? An introduction - LogRocket Blog
metatags.og:description: In this introductory guide, we'll talk about V, aka "Vlang," and why it may be a preferable alternative to other more complex languages.

qapage.name: Command line parsing lib VLang
qapage.description: I want to write a command line application with the V programming language. Is there a library for command line parsing?

question.name: Command line parsing lib VLang
question.text: I want to write a command line application with the V programming language. Is there a library for command line parsing?

answer.text: As of November 2020, the command-line arguments parsing is included in the standard library. Example from V repository import cli { Command, Flag } import os fn main() { mut cmd := Command{...

yes, the os module. this example outputs each command line argument import os fn main() { for arg in os.args { println(arg) } } when run on my system: program.exe hello! returns D:\Documents\V\prog...
You can use the official flag module. See for example: https://github.com/vlang/v/blob/689003454b5c60fa13a6a0b44c39f79847806609/tools/performance_compare.v#L204 This produces something like...
Natively: import os import flag const ( tool_version = '0.0.4' ) mut fp := flag.new_flag_parser(os.args) fp.version( tool_version ) With v-args library: import vargs // or import nedpals.vargs...
